v - t - e **Singapore Tamils**[*failed verification*] who majorly came from the [South Indian](/wiki/South_India) [state](/wiki/States_and_union_territories_of_India) of [Tamil Nadu](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu) and the [union territory](/wiki/Union_territory) [Puducherry](/wiki/Puducherry_(union_territory)) and some people are also from [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka).[*self-published source*] Singapore has emerged as the most preferred destination among migrants from Tamil Nadu. A study has revealed that 410,000 of the 2.2 million [Tamil Nadu diaspora](/wiki/Tamil_Nadu_diaspora) were residing in Singapore in 2015. ## Status [Tamil](/wiki/Tamil_language) is one of the four official [languages of Singapore](/wiki/Languages_of_Singapore). Tamil is taught as a second language in most government schools from primary to junior college levels. Tamil is an examinable subject at all major nationwide exams. There is a daily Tamil newspaper printed in Singapore, *[Tamil Murasu](/wiki/Tamil_Murasu)*. There is a full-time radio station, *[Oli 96.8FM](/wiki/Oli_96.8FM)*, and a full-fledged television channel, *[Vasantham](/wiki/Vasantham_(TV_channel))*.[*failed verification*] ## Little India [Little India, Singapore](/wiki/Little_India,_Singapore) is an ethnic place of Indians located in the east of Singapore and mostly follows the Tamil cultural heritage system.[*vague*] - Tamils portal - Singapore portal - [Indian Singaporeans](/wiki/Indian_Singaporeans) - [Tamil diaspora](/wiki/Tamil_diaspora)
title: Singapore Tamils
